A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Once we saw J.J.Abrams wasn't interested in directing future films we should of seen this bomb coming. He tried to give them a push in the right direction but it didn't work...In The Last Jedi nothing felt authentic or real. The whole movie felt like a cartoon.. Normal characters were all of a sudden able to do the impossible. Any connection to realism is thrown out the window\, ei: Leia getting blown up\, then sucked out into space and force flying back to safety!?  Waat?!) unneeded. Rushed character development\, goofy looking CGI where a costumed actor should of been. Some camera angles made the actors uncomfortable to look at. \nThe comedy relief; Holy crap was it terrible... writers didn't give a F*ck. The makers of this film settled with ideas\, Costumes looked like they were leftover from Halloween\, This is what happens when you make the big bucks now... RIP Star Wars.
